definitions.definition: cause or enable (a condition or state of affairs) to continue.
examples: the need to maintain close links between industry and schools

definitions.definition: keep (something) at the same level or rate.
examples: agricultural prices will have to be maintained

definitions.definition: keep (a building, machine, or road) in good condition or in working order by checking or repairing it regularly.
examples: keep in good condition, keep in (good) repair, keep up, service, care for, take good care of, look after the association maintains its private roads

definitions.definition: provide with necessities for life or existence.
examples: the allowance covers the basic costs of maintaining a child
synonyms: nourish "the cost of maintaining a dog"

definitions.definition: keep (a military unit) supplied with equipment and other requirements.

examples: the king swears he will maintain the laws of God

definitions.definition: state something strongly to be the case; assert.
examples: he has always maintained his innocence
synonyms: hold to; formalaver "he always maintained his innocence"
